title: The Whispering Shadows
content: Ravenwood Manor stands at the edge of the forest, abandoned for nearly a century. Locals say it was once home to the Holloway family, who vanished mysteriously one stormy night in 1892. Since then, travelers passing by after midnight have reported faint whispers drifting from its broken windows — soft voices calling their names, sometimes mimicking loved ones. The few who dared to investigate claimed to hear footsteps following them down empty corridors, shadows moving even when their lanterns were still. One man from the nearby village, desperate to prove the stories false, spent a night inside with a recorder. The next morning, only the recorder was found near the gates, playing back a single phrase in a trembling voice: 'You shouldn’t have listened.'

title: The Lantern by the Lake
content: Every year on the anniversary of a boating accident in 1957, a pale light appears over Black Hollow Lake. Fishermen and campers say it drifts slowly across the water, as if carried by an invisible hand. An old legend claims it belongs to a young woman named Evelyn Hart, who drowned searching for her lost fiancé during a storm. Locals have seen the light vanish suddenly when someone calls out her name. Some even claim that if you stare too long into the glow, you’ll see her reflection standing behind you — soaked, silent, and waiting for someone to take her place beneath the water.

title: The House That Breathed
content: Tenants never last long at 13 Willow Street. Every night around 3 a.m., the walls make a slow, drawn-out sigh, as if the house itself were breathing. Doors open and close without wind, and wallpaper peels away to reveal words written underneath — the same line, over and over: 'Still here.' A plumber once discovered a bricked-up crawlspace behind the basement furnace, large enough for someone to hide in. He sealed it up again without speaking a word. Now, the current owner swears that sometimes, when the air is still, she can hear breathing from inside the walls — and when she checks, the wallpaper is smooth again.
